svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
May 11, 2024" date: "2024-05-11"
Eth News and Links
All core devs â€“ execution (ACDE)
* ACDE #187 call video .Â Recap from Tim Beiko .Â Notes from Christine Kim :
Pectra-devnet-0 : launch early next week, some client teams completed implementations
EIP7702 set EOA account code for one transaction: successor to EIP3074, aimed at
improving EOAs and aligned with ERC4337 account abstraction Broad support for
including in Pectra SSZ priority : client teams didnâ€™t support changing to SSZ in
Pectra EOF: Meta EIP & EIP7698 creation transaction added to Pectra considered for
inclusion EIP7623 increase calldata costs: gas sheltering concerns theoretically
possible but deemed not viable Reentrancy protection: EIP7705 reentrancy opcodes
proposed to lower protection cost
* Pectra-devnet-0 : launch early next week, some client teams completed
implementations
* EIP7702 set EOA account code for one transaction: successor to EIP3074, aimed at
including in Pectra
improving EOAs and aligned with ERC4337 account abstraction
* Broad support for including in Pectra
* SSZ priority : client teams didnâ€™t support changing to SSZ in Pectra
SSZ priority : client teams didnâ€™t support changing to SSZ in Pectra
* EOF: Meta EIP & EIP7698 creation transaction added to Pectra considered for
inclusion
EOF: Meta EIP & EIP7698 creation transaction added to Pectra considered for inclusion
* EIP7623 increase calldata costs: gas sheltering concerns theoretically possible but
deemed not viable
EIP7623 increase calldata costs: gas sheltering concerns theoretically possible but
* Reentrancy protection: EIP7705 reentrancy opcodes proposed to lower protection cost
Reentrancy protection: EIP7705 reentrancy opcodes proposed to lower protection cost
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 ), small fork targeting late 2024
* consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.2 : test case fixes for Electra and fixes for PeerDAS
initial interop
consensus-specs v1.5.0-alpha.2 : test case fixes for Electra and fixes for PeerDAS
* EVM Object Format (EOF) website, work in progress
EVM Object Format (EOF) website, work in progress
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.7% still too close to 33.3% threshold Proposal to create Lido Research
to contribute to minimal viable issuance research
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.7% still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Proposal to create Lido Research
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~62% majority
Figment went Geth free Consensus layer: Prysm 37% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean
loss of finality Options for validators to share client info : graffiti, gossip or
voting
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~62% majority Figment went Geth free
Execution layer: Geth ~62% majority
* Figment went Geth free
* Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
Consensus layer: Prysm 37%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Options for validators to share client info : graffiti, gossip or voting
Options for validators to share client info : graffiti, gossip or voting
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* Account abstraction breakout #2 call video Native account abstraction on Layer 1 not
expected for several years (after Osaka upgrade) EIP7702 succeeds EIP3074, account
abstraction aligned with form factor of EIP5806 (new transaction type) & user
experience of EIP3074 Discussion on need for chain ID & nonce in EIP7702
Account abstraction breakout #2 call video
* Native account abstraction on Layer 1 not expected for several years (after Osaka
upgrade)
Native account abstraction on Layer 1 not expected for several years (after Osaka
* EIP7702 succeeds EIP3074, account abstraction aligned with form factor of EIP5806
(new transaction type) & user experience of EIP3074
EIP7702 succeeds EIP3074, account abstraction aligned with form factor of EIP5806 (new
transaction type) & user experience of EIP3074
* Discussion on need for chain ID & nonce in EIP7702
Discussion on need for chain ID & nonce in EIP7702
* Vitalik: multidimensional gas pricing
Vitalik: multidimensional gas pricing
* History growth viz : history growing ~8x faster than state, nodes using 2TB drives
will need to upgrade in 2-3 years unless EIP4444 adopted to halve the storage burden
History growth viz : history growing ~8x faster than state, nodes using 2TB drives
* Builder market centralization : private order flow & why builders win blocks
Builder market centralization : private order flow & why builders win blocks
Research
* Fork choice attacks and PeerDAS
Fork choice attacks and PeerDAS
* Asynchrony-resilient sleepy Total-Order Broadcast (TOB) protocols
Asynchrony-resilient sleepy Total-Order Broadcast (TOB) protocols
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Grandine v0.4.0/1 : optimizations, new attestations packer,
in-memory mode, improved compatibility with other validator clients, integrations with
Eth-docker & Ethereum on Arm
Consensus layer:
* Grandine v0.4.0/1 : optimizations, new attestations packer, in-memory mode, improved
compatibility with other validator clients, integrations with Eth-docker & Ethereum on
Arm
* Execution layer: Geth v1.14.3 : block processing & RPC API improvements
Execution layer:
* Geth v1.14.3 : block processing & RPC API improvements
For Stakers
* Geth DoS vulnerability via malicious p2p message , patched in v1.13.15
Geth DoS vulnerability via malicious p2p message , patched in v1.13.15
* EthStaker: hardware recommendations
EthStaker: hardware recommendations
Layer 2
* Rollcall (L2 standards) #5 call video : RIP7212 (secp256r1 precompile) spec
clarification & pricing, RIP7696 presentation (generic double scalar multiplication
precompile) and Layer 1 update
Rollcall (L2 standards) #5 call video : RIP7212 (secp256r1 precompile) spec
* Commitment Boost : proposal to standardize how proposers register & send/receive
commitments
Commitment Boost : proposal to standardize how proposers register & send/receive
* Overview on based sequencing & preconfirmations
Overview on based sequencing & preconfirmations
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7702 : Set EOA account code for one transaction EIP7703 : Increase calldata
cost (alternative to EIP7623 ) EIP7705 : NONREENTRANT & REENTRANT opcodes
EIPs:
* EIP7702 : Set EOA account code for one transaction
EIP7702 : Set EOA account code for one transaction
* EIP7703 : Increase calldata cost (alternative to EIP7623 )
EIP7703 : Increase calldata cost (alternative to EIP7623 )
* EIP7705 : NONREENTRANT & REENTRANT opcodes
EIP7705 : NONREENTRANT & REENTRANT opcodes
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7704 : Soul resonance token
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7704 : Soul resonance token
Stuff for developers
* Forge-std v1.8.2 : adds cheat codes including prompt, blobhashes & ensNamehash
Forge-std v1.8.2 : adds cheat codes including prompt, blobhashes & ensNamehash
* Solady (Solidity snippets): adds UpgradeableBeacon for ERC1967 beacon proxies
Solady (Solidity snippets): adds UpgradeableBeacon for ERC1967 beacon proxies
* Frangio: Solidity compiler code generation for stack-based EVM & stack too deep
errors
Frangio: Solidity compiler code generation for stack-based EVM & stack too deep errors
* Viem experimental adds ERC6492 signature utilities
Viem experimental adds ERC6492 signature utilities
* Slitherin (custom Slither detectors) v0.7.0 : adds detectors for Arbitrum Chainlink
sequencer uptime, readonly reentrancy with Balancer/Curve & price manipulation via
token transfers
Slitherin (custom Slither detectors) v0.7.0 : adds detectors for Arbitrum Chainlink
* Betterscan : inspect verified contracts
Betterscan : inspect verified contracts
* Profiling Echidna found memory leak in hevm
Profiling Echidna found memory leak in hevm
* Guide to building a tracer using Geth for transactions involving a set of addresses
Guide to building a tracer using Geth for transactions involving a set of addresses
* Etherscan converter tools : Base64, block & date, UTF-8 and method ID
Etherscan converter tools : Base64, block & date, UTF-8 and method ID
* CTFs: Secureum RACE #29: answers to 8 question Solidity quiz
CTFs:
* Secureum RACE #29: answers to 8 question Solidity quiz
Security
* Bloom $600k exploit on Blast related to rebasing yield, 90% of funds recovered
Ecosystem
* Etherscan: address poisoning attack explainer
Etherscan: address poisoning attack explainer
* ETHGlobal Sydney finalists
ETHGlobal Sydney finalists
* Verify RLN Proofs in resource restricted devices using subtrees
Verify RLN Proofs in resource restricted devices using subtrees
* Threshold encryption schemes for transaction pool privacy & timelock encryption
Threshold encryption schemes for transaction pool privacy & timelock encryption
Job Listings
* stakefish : DevOps Engineer & Full-stack Engineer
stakefish : DevOps Engineer & Full-stack Engineer
* Devcon: Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
Devcon: Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 2.6 to 28 gwei, with 5.6 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.3 gwei 13k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 2.6 to 28 gwei, with 5.6 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.3 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.3 gwei
* 13k ETH net issuance this week
13k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $2,888 - $3,202, currently $2,914
ETHUSD : $2,888 - $3,202, currently $2,914
* ETHBTC : currently 0.048 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.048 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Fantasy.top (CryptoTwitter fantasy sports game) 50% of mainnet NFT volume
Fantasy.top (CryptoTwitter fantasy sports game) 50% of mainnet NFT volume
* Tokenize.it Crowdinvesting : security tokens for German limited liability companies
Tokenize.it Crowdinvesting : security tokens for German limited liability companies
* BlackRock-backed Securitize applies for Arbitrum RWA incentives
BlackRock-backed Securitize applies for Arbitrum RWA incentives
* Zora acquired mint.fun
Zora acquired mint.fun
* Splits v2 : adds push flow, split can hold any token and splitters & token storage
are separate
Splits v2 : adds push flow, split can hold any token and splitters & token storage are
separate
Regulation/business/tokens
* Robinhood received Wells Notice from SEC
Robinhood received Wells Notice from SEC
* President Biden plans to veto congressional disapproval of SEC Staff Accounting
Bulletin 121 Trump attacks Biden for being anti-crypto
President Biden plans to veto congressional disapproval of SEC Staff Accounting
Bulletin 121
* Trump attacks Biden for being anti-crypto
* Crypto super PACs raised $102M for 2024 US elections
Crypto super PACs raised $102M for 2024 US elections
* Reminder: you can write to Virgil Griffith
Reminder: you can write to Virgil Griffith
General
* Next.js Server Actions Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability
Next.js Server Actions Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability
* Dell data breach of customer name & physical address
Dell data breach of customer name & physical address
* Spanish police identified Catalan activist via Wire & Proton Mail
Spanish police identified Catalan activist via Wire & Proton Mail
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-may-11-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* May 21-23 â€“ DappCon (Berlin)
May 21-23 â€“ DappCon (Berlin)
* May 24-26 â€“ ETHBerlin hackathon
May 24-26 â€“ ETHBerlin hackathon
* May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHDublin hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHDublin hackathon & conference
* May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHPrague conference & hackathon
May 31-Jun 2 â€“ ETHPrague conference & hackathon
* May 31-Jun 5 â€“ ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 5 â€“ ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
* Jun 14 â€“ EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
Jun 14 â€“ EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
* Jun 21-23 â€“ ETHKyiv hackathon & conference
Jun 21-23 â€“ ETHKyiv hackathon & conference
* Jul 8-11 â€“ EthCC (Brussels) conference
Jul 8-11 â€“ EthCC (Brussels) conference
* Jul 12-14 â€“ ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
Jul 12-14 â€“ ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
* Jul 26-30 â€“ EDCON Tokyo conference
Jul 26-30 â€“ EDCON Tokyo conference
* Aug 2-4 â€“ Ethereum Argentina
Aug 2-4 â€“ Ethereum Argentina
* Aug 15-17 â€“ Ethereum Uruguay hackathon & conference
Aug 15-17 â€“ Ethereum Uruguay hackathon & conference
* Aug 23-Sep 13 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 â€“ ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Aug 23-26 â€“ ETHTokyo hackathon & conference
Aug 23-26 â€“ ETHTokyo hackathon & conference
* Aug 29-31 â€“ ETHAccra hackathon
Aug 29-31 â€“ ETHAccra hackathon
* Sep 5-8 â€“ ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
Sep 5-8 â€“ ETHWarsaw conference & hackathon
* Sep 9-15 â€“ ETHSafari (Kenya)
Sep 9-15 â€“ ETHSafari (Kenya)
* Sep 12-14 â€“ NapulETH (Napoli)
Sep 12-14 â€“ NapulETH (Napoli)
* Sep 20-22 â€“ ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
Sep 20-22 â€“ ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
* Sep 26-27 â€“ ETHMilan conference
Sep 26-27 â€“ ETHMilan conference
* Oct 4-6 â€“ ETHRome hackathon
Oct 4-6 â€“ ETHRome hackathon
* Oct 17-19 â€“ ETHSofia conference & hackathon
Oct 17-19 â€“ ETHSofia conference & hackathon
* Oct 18-20 â€“ ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
Oct 18-20 â€“ ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
* Nov 12-15 â€“ Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
Nov 12-15 â€“ Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
* Nov 15-17 â€“ ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
Nov 15-17 â€“ ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
